channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Renee Nicole Good isn't the first death caused by ICE under Trump administration
item.description: The deadly incident in Minnesota isn't the first time ICE officers have been involved in violence under the Trump administration.
item.content:encoded: The deadly incident in Minnesota isn't the first time ICE officers have been involved in violence under the Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: Noem insists that ICE agent who fatally shot woman in Minneapolis did nothing wrong
item.description: Protests continue in Minneapolis over the death of a woman shot by an ICE agent. The head of Minnesota's investigative agency says federal officials have blocked it from conducting an investigation.
item.content:encoded: Protests continue in Minneapolis over the death of a woman shot by an ICE agent. The head of Minnesota's investigative agency says federal officials have blocked it from conducting an investigation.
item.dc:creator: Matt Sepic

item.title: Trump's second term has included a much more muscular foreign policy than his first
item.description: President Trump ran as the Peace President, but since taking office has been on a military spree with strikes on Iran, Yemen, Nigeria, Syria and Venezuela -- and threats against others.
item.content:encoded: President Trump ran as the Peace President, but since taking office has been on a military spree with strikes on Iran, Yemen, Nigeria, Syria and Venezuela -- and threats against others.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: Why the A's were denied a trademark to Las Vegas Athletics
item.description: The Athletics have suffered a number of setbacks in their quest to relocate to Las Vegas from Oakland. The latest? The U.S. says they can't actually get a trademark for the name Las Vegas Athletics.
item.content:encoded: The Athletics have suffered a number of setbacks in their quest to relocate to Las Vegas from Oakland. The latest? The U.S. says they can't actually get a trademark for the name Las Vegas Athletics.
item.dc:creator: Rafael Nam

item.title: The cautionary tale of how Chicago privatized its parking meters
item.description: In 2008, Chicago's mayor decided to lease out the city's metered parking system — to privatize all 36,000 of its parking meters.
item.content:encoded: In 2008, Chicago's mayor decided to lease out the city's metered parking system — to privatize all 36,000 of its parking meters.
item.dc:creator: Nick Fountain

item.title: Record snowfall in Juneau as Alaska towns have seen an intense start to the winter
item.description: In December, Juneau saw record-breaking snow, which collapsed several roofs and sank multiple boats in the harbor. Now, while they're still digging out, the city is bracing for an atmospheric river.
item.content:encoded: In December, Juneau saw record-breaking snow, which collapsed several roofs and sank multiple boats in the harbor. Now, while they're still digging out, the city is bracing for an atmospheric river.
item.dc:creator: Alix Soliman

item.title: Why is the U.S. pulling out of 31 U.N. groups? And what's the impact?
item.description: The Trump administration is withdrawing from 66 global groups, including U.N. entities that focus on climate and health issues.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration is withdrawing from 66 global groups, including U.N. entities that focus on climate and health issues.

(Image credit: Daniel Slim/AFP)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: Mamdani says New York child care expansion a real step to fulfilling campaign pledge
item.description: NYC Mayor Zohran Mamdani says a plan unveiled Thursday to take the first steps toward universal childcare for kids under five shows New Yorkers that "democracy can actually deliver for them."
item.content:encoded:
NYC Mayor Zohran Mamdani says a plan unveiled Thursday to take the first steps toward universal childcare for kids under five shows New Yorkers that "democracy can actually deliver for them."

(Image credit: Yuki Iwamura)
item.dc:creator: Elena Burnett

item.title: Senate Republicans deal Trump a rare rebuke with Venezuela war powers vote
item.description: In a rare rebuke to President Trump, five Republicans joined with Democrats on Thursday to advance a measure that would require congressional authorization for future military action in Venezuela.
item.content:encoded: In a rare rebuke to President Trump, five Republicans joined with Democrats on Thursday to advance a measure that would require congressional authorization for future military action in Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: Who was Renee Nicole Good?
item.description: We're continuing to learn more about the 37-year-old woman who was shot and killed by an Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer in Minneapolis on Wednesday.
item.content:encoded: We're continuing to learn more about the 37-year-old woman who was shot and killed by an Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer in Minneapolis on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Karen Zamora
